alert.note: Alert for Carroll; Central and Southeast Howard; Central and Southeast Montgomery; Frederick; Northwest Howard; Northwest Montgomery; Washington (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 19 at 5:22PM EST by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...SNOW SQUALL ACROSS I-70 AND I-270 CORRIDOR FROM HAGERSTOWN TO FREDERICK TO NORTHWEST DC SUBURBS... A snow squall is currently impacting the Interstate 70 corridor from Hagerstown to Mount Airy, and Interstate 270 from Frederick to Gaithersburg. Impacts are also ongoing along Maryland 200, Highway 40, and Highway 15 near Frederick. This snow squall is producing rapidly changing weather and road conditions, with brief heavy snow and gusty winds. A quick snow accumulation up to one inch is possible. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Be prepared for areas of blowing snow. This could lead to temporary whiteout conditions and the potential for dangerous driving conditions. If you are traveling and encounter adverse winter driving conditions, reduce speed and make sure headlights are on.
